DOC.brief_summary: The Vitamin D study design investigate effect body fat mass vitamin D level child . Earlier study show individual increase fat mass may low vitamin D level . Our specific hypothesis state child increase fat mass lower blood level vitamin D compare non-obese children.Since vitamin D primary hormone bone mineralization human , low level vitamin D could lead decrease bone mineral content child .
DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D Deficiency Low Bone Mineral Content Children
DOC.detailed_description: Fifty prepubertal male female child age 3-12 year participate study . Of , 25 obese child enrol study group , 25 non-obese child serve control . All subject fill comprehensive mineral intake questionnaire part study ensure adequate calcium intake prior study . All subject collect first morning urine sample calcium , creatinine , NTX . Fasting blood sample draw follow analytes : 25-hydroxyvitamin D , 1 , 25-dihydroxyvitamin D , intact PTH , calcium , phosphorus , magnesium , osteocalcin , insulin , c-peptide , fast blood glucose , leptin , adiponectin . Bone Mineral Content evaluate 16 obese subject vitamin D level < 30 nmol/L .
DOC.criteria: General : Prepubertal child ( male , testicular volume â‰¤ 3 cc , girl Tanner 1 breast ) age 711 year enrol study . Study group : Subjects BMI > 95th percentile age sex . Control group : All control subject BMI < 85th percentile age sex . know metabolic genetic disease result obesity severe hypothyroidism , pseudohypoparathyroidism , Cushing 's disease diabetes mellitus subject lipid lower medication subject medication know impact body weight calcium homeostasis subject history recent significant weight loss gain
DOC.keyword: Vitamin D deficiency , insulin resistance , obesity , bone
